title: NRO seeks innovative electro-optics
summary: The National Reconnaissance Office is casting a wide net in its latest bid for commercial Earth observation.

title: SpaceX to Launch Upgraded Starlink Satellites After Issues with First Batch
summary: SpaceX is preparing to launch its second batch of upgraded Starlink satellites after some of the first version 2 (v2) buses deorbited earlier than planned. Liftoff aboard a Falcon 9 rocket is scheduled for April 19 at 8:27 AM EDT (12:27 UTC) from Space Launch Complex 40 (SLC-40) at the Cape Canaveral Space Force Station.

title: Lower space company price tags pave the way to more acquisitions
summary: A drop in space company valuations could open the door to more transactions in the industry, according to an April 17 Space Symposium panel on the outlook for deals, as long as they can navigate increasing regulatory scrutiny.

title: NASA Awards Omnibus Multidiscipline Engineering Services III Contract
summary: NASA has awarded the Omnibus Multidiscipline Engineering Services (OMES) III contract to Space & Technology Solutions of Houston.

title: NASA releases architecture for human exploration of the moon and Mars
summary: NASA has released new details on the initial phases of its architecture to return humans to the moon as a step towards eventual missions to Mars.
